|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9882;QCA9882-2R4E; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 1 |rad2rxchains = 1 |rad2sstreams = 1 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam2 = <!-- AC-qam --> |rad2ac = 433 |rad2n = 150 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "2976443403" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
This FCC ID covers the R6000 and the R6100. Per the FCC test report... *The R6000 is 2x2 on the 2.4GHz band and 1x1 on the 5GHz band *The R6100 is 2x2 on the 2.4GHz band and 2x2 on the 5GHz band The FCC operational description states ''the device'' uses AR9334 (per the internal photos, AR9344-BC2A) and QCA9880 (looks to be QCA9882-2R4E). :Both devices are assumed to use the same '''QCA''' 5GHz radio.
The default SSID patterns are presumed to be '''NETGEARXX''' and '''NETGEARXX-5G'''.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
